title: Historical Controversies and Revisionism - Collection 2
description:
Historical Controversies and Revisionism - Collection 2:

We have 20 titles here:

-  Aaronovitch - Voodoo Histories; the Role of the Conspiracy Theory in Shaping Modern History (2010)

-  Berger & Lorenz (Eds.) - Nationalizing the Past; Historians as Nation Builders in Modern Europe (2010)

-  Bruinius - Better for All the World; the Secret History of Forced Sterilization and America's Quest for Racial Purity (2006)

-  Chomsky - Year 501, The Conquest Continues (1993)

-  Cremo & Thompson - Forbidden Archeology; the Hidden History of the Human Race (1998)

-  Epperson - The Unseen Hand; an Introduction to the Conspiratorial View of History (1985)

-  Faurisson - Impact and Future of Holocaust Revisionism (J. Historical Review, Jan-Feb 2000)

-  Galgano - Doing History; Research and Writing in the Digital Age (2008)

-  Hoffman (Eds.) - Major Problems in American History; Vol. 1, to 1877, 3e (2012)

-  Joseph (Ed.) - Discovering the Mysteries of Ancient America; Lost History and Legends Unearthed and Explored (2006)

-  McNeill - The Pursuit of Truth; a Historian's Memoir (2005)

-  Milner (Ed.) - A New Significance; Re-Envisioning the History of the American West (1996)

-  Morris - 1948; a History of the First Arab-Israeli War (2009)

-  Nickell - Unsolved History; Investigating Mysteries of the Past (2005)

-  Nicolov - The World Conspiracy; What the Historians Don't Tell You (1990)

-  Reed - The Controversy of Zion; the Hidden History of Zionism (1978)

-  Schraq & Haze - The Suppressed History of America (2011)

-  Tosh - The Pursuit of History; Aims, Methods and New Directions in the Study of Modern History, 5e (2010)

-  Weir - HistoryÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Greatest Lies; the Startling Truths behind World Events Our History Books Got Wrong (2009)

-  Yahya - A Historical Lie; the Stone Age (2006)
